result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Evan Tulgren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to contact Probation Agent today. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Evan Tulgren

records.addlTxt: Order for payment on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Payment plan to include $20.60 for case 12TR1032, $518 for case 22CF468, $518 for case 22CF399 and $417 for case 21CF261.  Def to pay $25 per month commencing 9/1/22. sf
added DNA Condition. e: DA, Atty Firkus, and DOC.   c: DE and SCSO. arc
e: DA, Atty Firkus, and DOC.    c: DE and SCSO. arc

10:45 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Matthew Evan Tulgren in court. Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Matthew Evan Tulgren.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF261, 21CF399 and 22CF468. There is an agreement however, Def has not supplied proof of AODA participation. OFF RECORD to allow Atty Firkus to get AODA paperwork in. Back on at 11:15 am. ADA Ballo is ready to proceed and recites agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. 
DE pleads GUILTY to 21CF399,Ct 1 - Bail Jumping and GUILTY to 22CF468, Ct 1 - Bail Jumping. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. 
Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 21CF399,Ct 1 - Bail Jumping and GUILTY to 22CF468, Ct 1 - Bail Jumping. On motion of the State without objection, Crt READS IN and dismisses in 21CF399, Count 2 and 22CF468, Ct 2 and 21CF261. 
It is noted that Atty Firkus has not been retained/appointed on 22CF468. Def would like to proceed and the Preliminary Hearing is waived in 22CF468. Sentencing arguments. The State to contact Sheriff's office within 7 days re: release of firearms to mother. Court Orders:

21CF399, Count 1 -  S/W 2 years probation with conditions: 
- Court Costs : $268.00.  Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court. 
Payment plan of $25/per month commencing on September 1, 2022 approved. 

- AODA and follow through with recommendation. Comply with AODA treatment plan. 
- Participate with any other programming as requested by DOC agent. 
- Absolute sobriety. Sobriety to be monitored by agent. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

21CF399, Count 1 -  S/W 2 years probation with conditions: 
- Court Costs : $268.00.  Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court. 
Payment plan of $25/per month commencing on September 1, 2022 approved. 

- AODA and follow through with recommendation. Comply with AODA treatment plan. 
- Participate with any other programming as requested by DOC agent. 
- Absolute sobriety. Sobriety to be monitored by agent. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

 Def to call probation agent today. Adjourned at: 11:40 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:07 AM  CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by zoom w/Matthew Evan Tulgren who appeared in person.  INCLUDES:  21CF261 and 21CF399 (FPT), 22CF468 (Set for INIT). Court questions Atty Firkus as to his zoom appearance today. Atty notes the matter is resolved, would like to set PLEAS.  Court confirms address of DE, removes JT from calendar. Adjourned:  10:10 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:22 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Matthew Evan Tulgren in court. DE Atty: Dan Firkus does not appear,  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CF261 (MH), 21CF399, 22CF468 (INIT). JA/Clerk have attempted to contact Atty Firkus without success.  Court reviews case and jury trial is scheduled and a new case has been filed. Def has also tried to to contact Atty Firkus. A review of Atty Firkus court calendar on CCAP shows that he may be in Polk County today. Atty Ballo states a global offer is being negotiated and also notes the motion hearing scheduled in case 21CF261 and is unsure why it was set for a motion hearing today. Atty Ballo believes they are  #2 for analyst however, JA to contact Atty Firkus to schedule another hearing this week.  9:33 am Atty Firkus now appears. Court extends deadline to this Friday, August 5th.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am. Includes 21CF261, 21CF399 and 22CF468
